title: DID for verified Career Audit Trail
description: Keeping your CV, references and skills current is an ongoing, cumbersome effort. The facts are not checked or verified wasting time & money.

f6_assessments.q0: Given the Challenge sates it's about small ways to incorporate DID's into the Cardano ecosystem as well as your intent "The PoC / stage 1 deliverable would be to provide a cross-link of the cardano PRISM and Metadata features" I 'Strongly Agree' this meets the challenge
f6_assessments.q1:
Given that you have a 'working semantic model and lot's of data' and having reviewed your existing Website 'People-Analytix'. You have demonstrated the technical ability to implement your proposal. 

Having been a PMP (Project Management Professional) for over 10 years I feel your timeline is in order. I would encourage you not to break up funding but keep the budget as is. To know you have the budget to complete your entire proposal gives me confidence you can sustain the staff and momentum to complete this successfully.

I do see the need for DID in the hiring process. My Friend just had to wait for about a week for a third party to do a background check and this was within the US.  I can't imagine how it could be done Globally by this same company. Especially since the Decentralization of Projects look for Global Resources.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given the project is clearly defined into three distinct components, 
    DAPP Development 
    Backend Integrations
    Verification & Certification Process:
I 'Strongly Agree' it is sufficient to Audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem statement should more closely align with the challenge however the solution is clear and reasonable.
The goal of using DIDs for a career audit trail aligns with the challenge objective.
The proposal is able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users. There are 756 million Linkedin users if even a fraction of one percent were to use the backend connectivity it would be millions. Proposer has potential early adopter companies lined up which is a strong go-to-market strategy.
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links.
The team has not been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal.
The budget is high but may be reasonable to achieve the goals depending upon team composition but is not broken down into identifiable items.
The timetable is realistic to complete the work and shows what is being done and when.
The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal.
The proposal does not identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with auditable milestones and a defined timeline.
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user. 
The proposal should detail specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals.
Based upon my experience, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea itself is very relevant, because it intends to connect the Atala Prism identity with a kind of curriculum, which is seriously verified, to prove the truth of the data provided. In this way, this proposal very well meets the main objectives of the challenge and also relates to the "DApps & Integrations" challenge. The problem I found here was about how this tool works, I thought the explanation about it was very short and not enough to understand how this technology works, especially for people outside the industry, like me. It would be beneficial if the author further detailed how this integration works, and explained in an accessible way to the public. In this way, the reliability of the proposal would only increase.
f6_assessments.q1: We have very little information about the author, all we know is that he has already built HR Tech/Data Driven products and companies, but we don't know his exact training area, nor some examples of these products/companies (it would be essential to include them, to increase the author's credibility), and we do not know its direct connection with the technologies of the Cardano ecosystem either. You can see that he has good technical knowledge and understand exactly what he wants to do and where he wants to go, through the very technical explanation of the proposal and the attached website. Despite this, it would be important to provide this information, in addition, it is not mentioned at any time if the author intends to hire other professionals to work on this project, it would be necessary, in my opinion, to at least hire a UI/UX designer to build the DApp interface. Regarding the roadmap, we have some information about how the project will take place, but there is a lack of detail in several parts, both in the action steps and in the explanation of the financial division.
f6_assessments.q2: The author himself acknowledges that the information he gives us about the project's execution is only an overview, when the most correct would be to present a minutely detailed plan of the development phases of the idea, especially when it comes to a proposal with such funding. high and of such complex content. It would be necessary for him to detail each of the parts he mentions in the overview, he would provide information on what would be done every 6 months, but 6 months is a long time, it would be necessary to understand what would happen in each month, for example, what order of the actions, who would be involved in each one of them (if there were other people working on the project)... About the financial division, in the same way, there is a lack of detail, the requested values ​​are extremely high, it would be necessary to explain them further, for example: "DAPP Development 20-40k USD". Like this? Could the value range between 20k and 40k? And if it was 20k, what would happen to the rest? Who would that money go to, all for the author? What would he do on a daily basis to make these developments? Two other issues that concern me are the fact that the author does not establish success metrics, this way it is very difficult for the community to monitor the progress of the project, and it also does not explain how the dissemination of this new tool created here would be, the marketing plan that would popularize its use. For these reasons, I believe auditability needs to be revised and improved.

solution: Using your DID linked to your job references, skills as an online, standardised & verified CV makes it accessible to humans and machines.
experience:
Built various HR Tech & Data Driven products & companies.  
Can reuse these components to make Cardano / ADA relevant to the career jouirney.
